Breathing in excessive carbon dioxide is: but people wearing cloth or surgical masks are in little to no danger of breathing in unhealthy amounts of carbon dioxide.
Prolonged use of tight: fitting masks, such as respirators, may cause health issues for some individuals with preexisting respiratory illnesses.
Hypoxia: a condition in which the tissues of the body are starved of oxygen, is claimed to be caused by prolonged use of face masks, but this is unlikely to occur in most people.
Hypercapnia: a condition arising from too much carbon dioxide in the blood, is also claimed to be caused by prolonged mask usage, but research and experts suggest that such extreme symptoms are unlikely to occur in most individuals, especially with cloth and surgical masks that are not tight-fitting.
